text:
Welcome to the user experiment of the Agricultural Rapid
Annotation Module based on the Segment Anything Model
(ARAMSAM). First of all thank you very much for
participating!

In the following windows you will receive
some background information as well as instructions for
your tasks. During this entire introduction phase you are
allowed to ask question to the experiment supervisor. The
experiment will take approximately one hour.

Click next to continue.

Artificial intelligence (AI) requires large amounts of high
quality training data. Image data for example requires
human helpers to encircle objects of interest within an
image to highlight that respective object for an AI model
to learn from.

In this experiment the task will be to
highlight maize kernels on maize ear images. The process
of highlighting will be later referred to as ANNOTATING
and the highlighted area will be later referred to as MASK.

Models that are trained on image masks to later predict
image masks themselves are called SEGMENTATION models.
This study aims to speed up the process of annotating
segmentation masks by comparing different annotation
methods.

This is the first of 4 tutorial sections. Now you will be
introduced to the general structure of the experiment user
interface.

Click 'Close' to start the fist tutorial step.
